# Artic Region – Staying Connected Initiative

**Reference:** cb-665-46760742
**Date Published:** May 17, 2024
**Tender Closing Date:** June 14, 2024, 2:00 PM EST

## Background

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO), Arctic Region, is seeking a consultant to support the development of a staff wellness program. The goals of this project include:

* Identifying current and upcoming opportunities to support staff wellness needs
* Coordinating and facilitating regular team huddles
* Providing advice on direction and content of the Arctic Region Staying Connected Team/channels

## Description

The selected consultant will work closely with the DFO, Arctic Region team to develop a robust staff wellness program. This includes:

* Analyzing stakeholder needs and developing a strategy to meet them
* Providing communication support for the team and its channels
* Facilitating regular team huddles to maintain open communication

## Requirements

* Consultancy services in business administration, public relations, and communication planning
* Expertise in stakeholder analysis, communication planning, and stakeholder management
* Experience working with similar clients

## Evaluation Criteria

* Technical merit: 70%
* Price: 30%

## Trade Agreements

This tender is subject to the following trade agreements:

* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
